verses.kjv: And it came to pass after these things, that Naboth the Jezreelite had a vineyard, which was in Jezreel, hard by the palace of Ahab king of Samaria.
verses.ct: Some time later, a man named Naboth from Jezreel owned a vineyard in Jezreel, right next to the palace of King Ahab of Samaria.

verses.kjv: And Ahab spake unto Naboth, saying, Give me thy vineyard, that I may have it for a garden of herbs, because it is near unto my house: and I will give thee for it a better vineyard than it; or, if it seem good to thee, I will give thee the worth of it in money.
verses.ct: Ahab spoke to Naboth and said, "Let me have your vineyard so I can use it as a vegetable garden, since it's right next to my palace. I'll give you a better vineyard in exchange, or if you prefer, I'll pay you whatever it's worth in silver."

verses.kjv: And Naboth said to Ahab, The LORD forbid it me, that I should give the inheritance of my fathers unto thee.
verses.ct: But Naboth replied to Ahab, "The LORD would never let me hand over my family's inherited land to you."

verses.kjv: And Ahab came into his house heavy and displeased because of the word which Naboth the Jezreelite had spoken to him: for he had said, I will not give thee the inheritance of my fathers. And he laid him down upon his bed, and turned away his face, and would eat no bread.
verses.ct: Ahab went back to his palace bitter and resentful because of what Naboth the Jezreelite had told him — that he would not give up his family's inherited land. He threw himself on his bed, turned toward the wall, and refused to eat.

verses.kjv: But Jezebel his wife came to him, and said unto him, Why is thy spirit so sad, that thou eatest no bread?
verses.ct: His wife Jezebel came to him and asked, "Why are you so upset that you won't even eat?"

verses.kjv: And he said unto her, Because I spake unto Naboth the Jezreelite, and said unto him, Give me thy vineyard for money; or else, if it please thee, I will give thee another vineyard for it: and he answered, I will not give thee my vineyard.
verses.ct: He told her, "I talked to Naboth the Jezreelite and said, 'Sell me your vineyard for silver, or if you'd rather, I'll trade you a different vineyard for it.' But he answered, 'I won't give you my vineyard.'"

verses.kjv: And Jezebel his wife said unto him, Dost thou now govern the kingdom of Israel? arise, and eat bread, and let thine heart be merry: I will give thee the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite.
verses.ct: Jezebel his wife said to him, "Aren't you the one who rules Israel? Get up, eat something, and cheer up. I'll get you the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite."

verses.kjv: So she wrote letters in Ahab’s name, and sealed them with his seal, and sent the letters unto the elders and to the nobles that were in his city, dwelling with Naboth.
verses.ct: So she wrote letters in Ahab's name, stamped them with his royal seal, and sent them to the elders and leading citizens who lived in Naboth's city.

verses.kjv: And she wrote in the letters, saying, Proclaim a fast, and set Naboth on high among the people:
verses.ct: In the letters she wrote, "Announce a day of fasting, and give Naboth a prominent seat among the people."

verses.kjv: And set two men, sons of Belial, before him, to bear witness against him, saying, Thou didst blaspheme God and the king. And then carry him out, and stone him, that he may die.
verses.ct: "Then seat 2 worthless men across from him to testify against him, saying, 'You cursed God and the king.' After that, take him outside and stone him to death."

verses.kjv: And the men of his city, even the elders and the nobles who were the inhabitants in his city, did as Jezebel had sent unto them, and as it was written in the letters which she had sent unto them.
verses.ct: The elders and leading citizens of his city carried out exactly what Jezebel had instructed them to do, following everything written in the letters she had sent.

verses.kjv: They proclaimed a fast, and set Naboth on high among the people.
verses.ct: They announced a fast and gave Naboth a prominent seat among the people.

verses.kjv: And there came in two men, children of Belial, and sat before him: and the men of Belial witnessed against him, even against Naboth, in the presence of the people, saying, Naboth did blaspheme God and the king. Then they carried him forth out of the city, and stoned him with stones, that he died.
verses.ct: Then 2 worthless men came in and sat across from him. These men testified against Naboth in front of everyone, saying, "Naboth has cursed God and the king." So they dragged him outside the city and stoned him to death.

verses.kjv: Then they sent to Jezebel, saying, Naboth is stoned, and is dead.
verses.ct: Then they sent word to Jezebel: "Naboth has been stoned and is dead."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Jezebel heard that Naboth was stoned, and was dead, that Jezebel said to Ahab, Arise, take possession of the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite, which he refused to give thee for money: for Naboth is not alive, but dead.
verses.ct: As soon as Jezebel heard that Naboth had been stoned to death, she told Ahab, "Get up and take ownership of the vineyard that Naboth the Jezreelite refused to sell you, because Naboth is no longer alive — he's dead."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Ahab heard that Naboth was dead, that Ahab rose up to go down to the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite, to take possession of it.
verses.ct: When Ahab heard that Naboth was dead, he got up and went down to Naboth the Jezreelite's vineyard to claim it as his own.

verses.kjv: And the word of the LORD came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying,
verses.ct: Then the word of the LORD came to Elijah the Tishbite:

verses.kjv: Arise, go down to meet Ahab king of Israel, which is in Samaria: behold, he is in the vineyard of Naboth, whither he is gone down to possess it.
verses.ct: "Go down to meet King Ahab of Israel, who is in Samaria. Look — he is in Naboth's vineyard, where he has gone to take possession of it."

verses.kjv: And thou shalt speak unto him, saying, Thus saith the LORD, Hast thou killed, and also taken possession? And thou shalt speak unto him, saying, Thus saith the LORD, In the place where dogs licked the blood of Naboth shall dogs lick thy blood, even thine.
verses.ct: "Tell him this: 'The LORD says: Have you murdered a man and stolen his property?' Then tell him: 'The LORD says: In the very spot where dogs licked up Naboth's blood, dogs will lick up your blood — yes, yours.'"

verses.kjv: And Ahab said to Elijah, Hast thou found me, O mine enemy? And he answered, I have found thee: because thou hast sold thyself to work evil in the sight of the LORD.
verses.ct: Ahab said to Elijah, "So you've tracked me down, my enemy!" Elijah answered, "Yes, I have — because you have given yourself over to doing what is evil in the LORD's sight."

verses.kjv: Behold, I will bring evil upon thee, and will take away thy posterity, and will cut off from Ahab him that pisseth against the wall, and him that is shut up and left in Israel,
verses.ct: "I am going to bring disaster on you. I will wipe out your descendants and eliminate every male in Ahab's line, whether slave or free, throughout Israel."

verses.kjv: And will make thine house like the house of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, and like the house of Baasha the son of Ahijah, for the provocation wherewith thou hast provoked me to anger, and made Israel to sin.
verses.ct: "I will make your dynasty like the dynasty of Jeroboam son of Nebat, and like the dynasty of Baasha son of Ahijah, because you have provoked my anger and led Israel into sin."

verses.kjv: And of Jezebel also spake the LORD, saying, The dogs shall eat Jezebel by the wall of Jezreel.
verses.ct: The LORD also spoke about Jezebel: "Dogs will devour Jezebel by the wall of Jezreel."

verses.kjv: Him that dieth of Ahab in the city the dogs shall eat; and him that dieth in the field shall the fowls of the air eat.
verses.ct: "Any of Ahab's family who dies in the city will be eaten by dogs, and any who dies in the open country will be eaten by birds."

verses.kjv: But there was none like unto Ahab, which did sell himself to work wickedness in the sight of the LORD, whom Jezebel his wife stirred up.
verses.ct: There was never anyone like Ahab, who gave himself over completely to doing what was wicked in the LORD's sight, urged on by his wife Jezebel.

verses.kjv: And he did very abominably in following idols, according to all things as did the Amorites, whom the LORD cast out before the children of Israel.
verses.ct: He acted in the most disgusting ways by chasing after idols, just as the Amorites had done — the people the LORD had driven out ahead of the Israelites.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Ahab heard those words, that he rent his clothes, and put sackcloth upon his flesh, and fasted, and lay in sackcloth, and went softly.
verses.ct: When Ahab heard these words, he tore his clothes in grief, put on rough sackcloth against his skin, fasted, slept in sackcloth, and walked around subdued.

verses.kjv: And the word of the LORD came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying,
verses.ct: Then the word of the LORD came to Elijah the Tishbite:

verses.kjv: Seest thou how Ahab humbleth himself before me? because he humbleth himself before me, I will not bring the evil in his days: but in his son’s days will I bring the evil upon his house.
verses.ct: "Have you noticed how Ahab has humbled himself before me? Because he has humbled himself before me, I will not bring the disaster during his lifetime. Instead, I will bring it on his family during his son's reign."
